name: CVE-2018-14598
description: An issue was discovered in XListExtensions in ListExt.c in libX11 through 1.6.5. A malicious server can send a reply in which the first string overflows, causing a variable to be set to NULL that will be freed later on, leading to DoS (segmentation fault).
pattern: [(software:cpe='cpe:2.3:a:x.org:libx11:*:*:*:*:*:*:*:*') OR (software:cpe='cpe:2.3:o:debian:debian_linux:8.0:*:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:o:canonical:ubuntu_linux:16.04:*:*:*:lts:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:o:canonical:ubuntu_linux:14.04:*:*:*:lts:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:o:canonical:ubuntu_linux:12.04:*:*:*:esm:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:o:canonical:ubuntu_linux:18.04:*:*:*:lts:*:*:*') OR (software:cpe='cpe:2.3:o:fedoraproject:fedora:28:*:*:*:*:*:*:*')]

external_references.description: This object was created using cve2stix from the Signals Corps.
